thread.title: Queensland gets its five start-up finalists
thread.title_full: Queensland gets its five start-up finalists | Business Spectator

author: David Swan
title: Queensland gets its five start-up finalists
text:
Queensland start-up investment event RiverPitch has announced its five finalists, who will each pitch their start-ups to a room full of investors later this month.
RiverPitch, hosted by Brisbane co-working space River City Labs, will see the five start-ups pitch to some of Australia’s highest profile investors including Black Sheep Capital and RiverPitch founder Steve Baxter.
Black Sheep Capital director Daniel Gavel said his firm was always supportive of initiatives to help showcase start-ups and help build out the Brisbane ecosystem.
“The past few events have been well supported and attended, so it also provides the chance to network and build new relationships. Black Sheep invests in startups that stand out - and RiverPitch is the place to see them on show in Brisbane,” Mr Gavel said.
Finalists include home delivery service YourGrocer, cloud-based start-up Way We Do, workforce software firm Fewzion, industrial equipment firm MOVUS and vehicle share start-up Carhood.
The event is a bi-yearly event that brings together investors and investment-ready teams, to help get their ideas funded.
Christ Titley, Senior Adviser at Morgans, said: “Morgans is delighted to continue our sponsorship of the RiverPitch event for a second time. Over the past six months we have continued to see further investment in the technology sector as well as broader based efforts to accelerate investment in this sector.
"As one of Australia’s largest full service stockbroking firms, with a head office based in Brisbane, we are delighted to provide assistance to these entrepreneurs on a local level and aid them on their journey to success,” he said.
“We believe Brisbane will continue to produce some truly successful companies within this sector and RiverPitch is an ideal platform for them to showcase their outstanding ideas. Steve Baxter and his team have done a fabulous job at River City Labs thus far, aiding and promoting innovation and we believe the resources and collaboration of ideas within a centralized hub is critical to continue to produce world-class businesses.
"We look forward to continual engagement.”
